alert.note: Alert for Nowata; Washington (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 02 at 6:34PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Washington and northern Nowata Counties through 700 PM CST... At 633 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Wann to 4 miles east of Dewey to 3 miles southeast of Bartlesville. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Bartlesville... South Coffeyville... Delaware... Lenapah... Wann... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CST for northeastern Oklahoma.
